description.narrative: The Alert identified four impact domains of the COVID-19 crisis in northern Uganda: increased VAC and SGBV; increased MHPSS cases; higher risk of severe complications for elderly individuals; and PPE shortages at key health facilities. The approach proposed addressed three of the impacts. This consortium will leverage the collective strengths of our partners and address child protection and MHPSS concerns and manage procurement of PPE. The goal of the project is to help at-risk children, their caregivers and those who are struggling with psycho-social issues understand and navigate the systems and services available to them, while at the same time strengthening the capacity of the frontline staff in those systems. To address the issues of child protection and MHPSS, we propose to implement a multi-pronged mass media campaign targeting the general population with simple and effective messages by radio, while also supporting existing project volunteers/champions to spread the messages within their communities. In Karamoja where radio listenership is low, the project will use loudspeaker campaigns across the four targeted districts over 20 days. The mass media campaigns will include short messages across the three domains and a weekly series of five 1-hour sessions focused on parenting and stress management to support families. Where MOH, MGLSD and partners have already developed messages, the project will utilize these to deliver consistent messages aligned with government. For those messages that need be developed, a workshop with MOH and MGLSD will be held to ensure buy-in and ownership of the developed messages.
